subject: RE: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?

messageBody:
JUnit is a framework. Any framework has a scope, and is an attempt to make
it easy to do something within that scope.
The result of course is that IF you want to do something out of that scope,
the framework becomes a limitation.
I never had to look into the source, did it just out of curiosity anyway,
though. And it probably is not very straightforward to understand.
But I suspect that the people who discovered Design Patterns/XP/Refactoring
might have some idea on Object Oriented design ;-)
If it doesn't work for me straight away, my first idea is to check if I
understand how it should be used.
But I hate this attitude in particular: "Junit internals suck. I would love
to rewrite it, but don't have the time." No arguments, or concrete ideas,
just complaining.
Could he define the code smell "the code sucks" ?

>

> DS > you misunderstood the comments from other people. JUnit
> is a good

> example
> DS > of XP development. The problem with XP is that it is
> not designed for
> DS > Library software (see the last chapter of the xp book),
> so it works
> good
> DS > at what it was designed for, but it is difficult to
> expand. They also

> Anyway, just
